original: NORINDER, Ernst Harald, Professor, Uppsala, f Norrkp 3/3 88 av lokmäst E A N o Ellen Jonsson, gm Eva Malmqvist. Mog.ex Upps 07, inskr v Upps univ 08, aman v meteorolog inst där 12—18, assist 19—20, fil kand 15, fil lic 21, fil dr s å. Anst v Vattenf.-styr:s kraftverksbyrå 22—24, tf bitr byråing där 25—27, tf byråing o led f anläggn f undersökn av elektr överspänn på kraftledn v Husbyborg Upps 27—32, doc i experimentell elektricitetslära i Upps 28—32, prof där i elektricitetslära m särsk hänsyn t atmosfäriska urladdningar sed. 32 samt prefekt f inst f högspänn.forskn där fr s å. Föret ett flert studie- och föreläsn.resor t europ länder o USA. Utf undersökn betr blixtens fysikaliska egensk o av blixturladdn framkallade störningar på kraftledn samt konstr spec katodstråloscillografer härför. Led av sakk.ktén f utredn betr åskledarekontrollanst :s omorg, av Sv nationalktéerna f geodesi o geofys sed. 34, f vetenskapl radiotelegrafi sed. 33, f fysik sed. 40. RNO, LVS, IVA:s mindre GM.
translated: NORINDER, Ernst Harald, Professor, Uppsala, born in Norrköping on March 3, 1888, son of locomotive master E A N and Ellen Jonsson, married to Eva Malmqvist. Graduated from Uppsala University in 1907, enrolled at Uppsala University in 1908, assistant at the Meteorological Institute from 1912 to 1918, assistance from 1919 to 1920, Bachelor of Arts in 1915, Licentiate of Philosophy in 1921, Doctor of Philosophy in the same year. Employed at the Water Authority's power plant bureau from 1922 to 1924, acting deputy bureau engineer from 1925 to 1927, acting bureau engineer and head of the facility for the investigation of electrical overvoltages on power lines in Husbyborg, Uppsala from 1927 to 1932, docent in experimental electricity in Uppsala from 1928 to 1932, professor in electricity with special attention to atmospheric discharges since 1932, and head of the Institute for High Voltage Research there from the same year. Undertook several study and lecture trips to European countries and the USA. Carried out investigations on the physical properties of lightning and the disturbances caused by lightning discharges on power lines, as well as the construction of special cathode ray oscillographs for this purpose. Member of the committee for the investigation of lightning conductor control for the National Observatory, member of the Swedish National Committees for Geodesy and Geophysics since 1934, for Scientific Radiotelegraphy since 1933, and for Physics since 1940. Knight of the Order of the North Star, Member of the Royal Physiographic Society in Lund, and Associate Member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences.
